definition: to take the lead/to gain the upper hand
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Rational selfinterest is not always the dominating factor.
sentences.chinese: 理性的個體利益不總是佔上風的因素。

sentences.english: Money talks way too loud in our country.
sentences.chinese: 在我國，金錢萬能太佔上風了。

sentences.english: Which scenario will prevail in the months ahead?
sentences.chinese: 今後的幾個月哪種結局會佔上風？

sentences.english: Until fairly recently, it seemed that Chevron would prevail.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近，似乎雪佛龍公司將佔上風。

sentences.english: Force them to speak English and you win.
sentences.chinese: 逼着他們跟你講英語，你纔會佔上風。

sentences.english: This cook just happened to be rather ignorant, so he did not mind being cruel when he had the upper hand.
sentences.chinese: 這個廚師恰好無知愚魯，在佔上風時，手下毫不留情。

sentences.english: When we make decisions in advance it's Should that's incharge.
sentences.chinese: 當我們提前做決定時，就是“應該”佔上風了。

sentences.english: There are initial signs that the younger generation may be prevailing.
sentences.chinese: 初步跡象顯示，年輕一代可能佔上風。

sentences.english: At the end of the day, reality will prevail; you can count on it.
sentences.chinese: 最終，現實主義會佔上風，你可以信任這種態度。

sentences.english: Do not let anxiousness or frustration take over.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓焦慮或沮喪佔上風。
